Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Impair_Asset_WWS_Data.description: A reference to the asset that will be impaired.

validation.validation: The asset specified cannot currently be impaired because it has other activity in progress.
The provided Asset cannot currently have its cost adjusted.
Impairment cannot be performed on Discrete Composite Asset or Components of Non-Discrete Composite Asset.
The asset is part of a lease contract. You can't impair leased assets.
validation.description: The asset is part of a lease contract. You can't impair leased assets.

Impair_Asset_WWS_Data.description: The transaction effective date for the asset impairment. This date cannot be before the acquisition date, in service date, the last cost adjustment or impairment date for the asset. The ledger period status must be valid for this date.

validation.validation: Impairment Date (transaction effective date) cannot be prior to Date Acquired
Impairment Date (transaction effective date) cannot be prior to last post acquisition adjustment date, last impairment date or last useful life adjustment date.
Impairment Date (transaction effective date) cannot be prior to Date Placed in Service.
Depreciation Start Date for Impairment cannot be prior to Last Resume Date.
Ledger period must exist for the impair depreciation start date.

Impair_Asset_WWS_Data.description: Workday calculates the impairment amount as Current Market Value – New Market Value. For a negative cost asset, enter a negative amount for the New Market Value that is greater than the Current Market Value and the Residual Value. For a positive cost asset, enter a positive amount for the New Market Value that is less than the Current Market Value and the Residual Value.

validation.validation: The new market value entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The new market value entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

validation.validation: New Market Value cannot be negative.
New Market Value cannot be positive.
Enter a New Market Value that's greater than the Current Market Value.
Enter a New Market Value that's less than the residual value.
Enter a New Market Value that's less than the Current Market Value.
Enter a New Market Value that's greater than the residual value.

Asset_Impairment_ReasonObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_Impairment_ReasonObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_Impairment_ReasonObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Impair_Asset_WWS_Data.description: A reference to the Asset Impairment Reason for this activity.

Asset_BookObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_BookObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_BookObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Impair_Asset_WWS_Data.description: Reference to asset books that are used by the asset. Enter asset books if you want to restrict the impairment to specific books. To enact this lifecycle event for all asset books, leave this field blank.

validation.validation: Restricted to Book is required when the asset has at least one fully depreciated book
At least one of the Restricted to Books is not valid for asset. Only assets already defined and not loaded into Workday or transferred from different company fully depreciated are valid.

Impair_Asset_WWS_Data.description: An optional comment text to include with the asset impairment.

description: Contains data used to process the asset impairment.
